name: title
text: How fast does your app start? Let's see what happens when dioxide scans a package with expensive imports.

name: show_adapters
text: Here are three adapters. Each one simulates a heavy SDK import, like Stripe or SendGrid, with a point-four second sleep at module level.

name: eager_scan
text: With eager scanning, dioxide imports every module upfront. Three adapters, each sleeping point-four seconds. Over a second just to start up.

name: run_eager
text: Watch. One-point-two seconds. All three adapters loaded, whether you need them or not.

name: lazy_intro
text: Now the same package, but with lazy equals true. Dioxide reads the source code with AST parsing. No imports. No sleeps.

name: run_lazy
text: One millisecond. The container knows what's available, but nothing has been imported yet.

name: first_resolve
text: When you resolve a port, only that adapter gets imported. One module, point-four seconds, instead of all three.

name: closing
text: Lazy scanning. Load what you need, when you need it.
